document_data.name: Goldenight
document_data.mainbody: '''Goldenight''' was a night festival held in [[Waterdeep]] as part of the [[Waukeentide]] holiday.
document_data.Description: The festival celebrated money and [[gold]]. It was common for people celebrating the holiday, including [[noble]]s, to cover themselves in gold dust and coin-shaped jewelry. It was also common for shops and businesses to stay open and to offer sales and promotions throughout the night.
document_data.History:
Originally a separate holiday, Goldenight was incorporated into Waukeentide and became one of the [[tenday]]-long holiday's many festivities.

In the Goldenight of [[1367 DR]], four [[aurumvorax]] found their way out of [[Undermountain]] through a ''[[gate]]'' that led to the [[Old Xoblob Shop]] in the [[Dock Ward of Waterdeep|Dock Ward]]. The creatures caused the death of several patrons of the neighboring [[Purple Palace]]. When reporting the incident to the [[City Watch (Waterdeep)|City Watch]], the proprietor [[Dandalus Ruell]] suggested that the creatures' ability to breach through the shop's magical defenses constituted foul play.
